kundli.formSubtitle: Enter your birth details to unlock insights into your destiny.
kundli.kundliDescription: A Kundli, also known as a Janam Kundali or birth chart, is a fundamental tool in Vedic Astrology. It is an astrological chart prepared based on the exact date, time, and place of an individual's birth. This chart serves as a cosmic map, representing the specific positions of the sun, moon, planets, and other celestial bodies at the moment of birth.
kundli.significanceDescription: It is believed that the planetary positions at your time of birth influence your personality, characteristics, relationships, career, health, and overall life path. A detailed analysis of the Kundli can provide deep insights into your strengths, weaknesses, potential opportunities, and challenges. It is often used for making important life decisions, understanding compatibility, and identifying remedial measures to mitigate negative planetary influences.
kundli.howGeneratedDescription: To create an accurate Kundli, three pieces of information are essential: your full date of birth, the precise time of birth, and the city of birth. Our system uses this data to perform complex astrological calculations, determining the Ascendant (Lagna) and the placement of planets across the 12 houses (Bhavas) of the zodiac, providing you with a personalized astrological blueprint.

errors.dobRequired: Full Date of Birth (Day, Month, Year) is required.
errors.invalidDate: Invalid date (e.g., Feb 30 is not a valid date).
errors.tobRequired: Time of Birth (Hour and Minute) is required.

reportDetails.footerText: This report offers a foundational analysis of your birth chart. For personalized insights, consult a professional astrologer.

resultPage.noKundliData: No Kundli data found to display.

whatIsAshtakavarga.title: What is Ashtakavarga?
whatIsAshtakavarga.content: Ashtakavarga is a unique system in Vedic astrology for evaluating a planet's strength. It assigns points (Bindus) to houses based on planetary positions, providing a nuanced score. 'Ashta' means eight, referring to the seven planets plus the Ascendant (Lagna) as points of reference.

howCalculated.title: How It's Calculated & Used
howCalculated.content: The system generates a Sarvashtakavarga (SAV) score for each house by totaling the benefic points given by the eight sources. This score indicates the house's overall strength and potential to deliver results.
listItems: A score above 30 Bindus is considered very strong, promising auspicious results.
A score between 25 and 30 is good and indicates favorable conditions.
A score below 25 suggests weakness, pointing to potential challenges in that area of life.

benefitsInPredictions.title: Benefits in Predictions
benefitsInPredictions.content: Astrologers use Ashtakavarga to make precise predictions and recommendations. It helps to:
listItems: Assess House Strength: Quickly identify which areas of life (career, wealth, relationships) are fortified or vulnerable.
Time Events: Pinpoint favorable periods by analyzing planetary transits over high-scoring houses.
Refine Judgements: Determine if a planet will act as a benefic or malefic in a specific chart, beyond its natural tendencies.
